greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Table (read by rows) giving the coefficients of sum formulas of n-th Lucas numbers (A000204). The k-th row (k>=1) contains T(i,k) for i=1 to k, where k=[2*n+1+(-1)^(n-1)]/4 and T(i,k) satisfies L(n) = Sum_{i=1..k} T(i,k) * n^(k-i) / (k-1)!.
link: Ron Knott, The Lucas Numbers in Pascal's Triangle.
example: L(13)=521; substituting n=13 in the formula of the k-th row we obtain k=7 and the coefficients
results.author: _André F. Labossière_, Nov 30 2004
